structure.unit: A JUDICIAL SUPPORT AGENCIES AND PERSONNEL

law.catch_line: Sentencing level relating to plea bargaining.
law.text:
The sentencing level of the system shall consist of at least the following information in regard to plea bargaining:
Did the defendant plead guilty to any offense in exchange for a lesser penalty or in exchange for dropping other charges against him;
If the answer to subsection (1) of this section is yes:
What offenses and levels of offense was a guilty plea accepted to; list each separately; and
What offenses and levels of offense were dismissed in exchange for a plea of guilty; list each separately;
What punishment was imposed for each offense for which a plea of guilty was accepted in exchange for a lesser penalty or in exchange for dropping charges:
Imprisonment; list offense and term of imprisonment for each offense separately; and
Fine; list offense, and amount of fine for each offense separately;
Was probation, suspended sentence or any other nonimposition of sentence imposed for any offense where a plea of guilty was made in exchange for a lesser penalty or in exchange for dropping other charges:
Describe each separately; and
Describe any conditions placed upon each; list separately.
law.history: Created 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 389, sec. 18, effective July 15, 1986.
